review_blob: 12 oz. bottle from specs. very smooth porter.. average to small head. light carbonation. chocolate and roasted malt aroma.  great palate. would be a regular for me if i had access to it.  anchor porter blows the anchor steam out of the water, no pun intended. well, , maybe a little

on tap at alamo drafthouse.. served ina tulip. great strong ale with fruity aroma. beautiful looking beer. bubbles non stop, head is always there at the bottom.  the flavor is strong pears and maybe a hint of green apple. 8.5% is shockingly delicious

12oz bottle.  verry hoppy stout.. tastes distinctly of northwest hops and espresso aftertaste.  a hint of chocolate. color is darkblack, completely opaque. dark tan dissapating head. the 9.1% alcohol is very well masked. i loved this beer.
as the name describes ... a very sweet brown and nutty flavor/aroma.  the hazelnut extract really stands out.  good lacing all the way down, one of the nicest looking brown ales ive seen.  bueno!
amber color.. hints of sweet grains.  is really identifiable due to  a unique taste.  a swig of it on the east coast and i can taste the west coast... only way i can describe the uniqueness
i love this beer!  dark ruby/red color.. malty scent. a little fruity and the high ABV is very surprising.

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: 12oz bot in the summer variety show. pours a bronze amber with little head around the edges. flavor is soapy tones of citrus spice.  not all that impressed but it isa double ipa and that is quite bitter for my tasting.  like i said, it came in the pack

Ok, so it is not a pefect 5 but it is for appearance. I just had to overrate this beer to balance out all the morons who underrate it.   

1) Do not buy the 6 pack of bottles, buy the 4 pack of cans.  they are not the same and you are not getting the real deal. 

2) Do not give it .5 and say it has no flavor. It has plenty of flavor, its just that YOU HAVE NO TASTE. .. you should be banned from rating for saying such a thing and yet you take it one step further by promoting Irish car bombs.  To take a perfectly good guinness and make it curdle unless you chug it.. well to me thats just blasphemer.   Go back to your milller light because iti s no longer saint patricks day where you are. You have ruined that where you are quite clearly.  Jerk.

Bottle.  Got this in Bradford, PA in the variety pack.   Pours a dark ruby red when heId up to the Iight.  thick tan/cream head that sticks around until the bottom.  I taste roasted malt and a touch of burnt coffee. Im not sure what I was most impressed with here - the appearance, the fact that it tastes nowhere near 6.5% aIc, or the price?

 ..This costs 15.50 a case in a town that overcharges for beer.  An exceptional deal.

gahh  where to start...  its got some flavor but not a lot and not a good one.  the last guy that rated said cardboard and that is kind of accurate.. like a corn flavord cardboard i guess.   dont look that great or smell that great.   hopefully you can do better wherever you are. though i know there a lot of places you cant, in PA at least .  if you can, find the yuengling porter, its better... or better yet, if you can, find  a better brewer
UPDATED: NOV 20, 2006

pours amber brown with ok head.  average but distinguishable and unique aroma. flavor isnt overpowering to inexperienced palates.  goes down smooth.  alc% isnt that high but I can sure put a lot of these away and not a lot of time!

bottle, nice honey-tea color with good head that sticks arond,  a little bitter aftertaste and the flavor keeps me interested although not overly impressed.   if its between this and a budwieser or miller you know which to go with.  if its between this and another english ale    i would go with the other.

the citrus flavor stands out the most.. pretty hoppy but not a lot compared to most ipa, also not very malty.   bitter and dry finish.  had it on tap and it poured a nice color but the overall appearance was nothing special
Malty aroma.  pours deep red with slightly tan head.  not too too sweet with a hoppy finish

Bottle pours amber... again with the troegs, head dissapates quickly. cant taste the high alc% on this one until the bottom.  Sweet flavor with a touch of somethin that reminds me of a kind of tart fruit... maybe black cherry or grape
starts off with nice head that dissapates soon like most troegs do.. a good  slightly above average brown ale.
beer_name: Tregs Rugged Trail Nut Brown Ale

review_blob: aroma is nothing special but  its appearance makes up for it.  a slightly hoppy bitterness with twist of citrus and goes down smooth.  didnt quite meet my expectations ... being an anchor beer i was hoping for something a little bit more.

I had this on tap at Pipers Pub.   Im not sure if it was something they did when it was poured or what but the first sip was sweet and had a sugary aftertaste when i licked my lips.   the rest of the beer was not sweet just good.  i wouldnt have guessed it to have a 6.5 alc% either.  i recomend giving this a try , i was satisfied with the one i had despite it was 6 bucks

only mild spicyness for a pale ale of  this caliber.  decent head that stays with all the way down. wood color with much floaties... try not to get any sediment in this one.  pours bubbly.  ***not a good drink with food.  wait a few minutes and cleanse your palate first before going back to your glass.
Very nutty brown ale.. thin  to medium head that disapates about 8oz down.  one of the better nutbrowns ive had . the decanting is important with bells.
transparent amber color and very flavorful.. not too hoppy but kind of bitter with a moderate amount of spice.
beer_name: Great Lakes Burning River Pale Ale

review_blob: average to below.  very light beer... thin and crisp. not much going on here but it is one of the better molsons available in PA.
pretty creamy.. id still advise staying away from this one and not let the name pull you in.  its a beer to be drank out of plastic cups off of a ping pong table by underage colleg students.
its real corny.  better than highlife or genuine draft.  no one i knew liked it that much.

Extremely fruity and sugary. Also extremely potent. The label says it all. <<<<,,

Anyway, what they say is true   the longer it sits on your shelf the dryer it gets but I dont necessarily recommend waiting around.   Not very thick.

I found myself liking this belgian very much, but  I think that may just be personal.  To say the least, its worth trying.

Well, considering Pennsylvania seems to have half the Raspberry Imperial Stouts in the world, it would make sense that Ive chosen this as my favorite.  Comparaive to Weyerbachers version, this beer is more complete as far as the presence of the rasberry in the flavor/appearance/aroma.  Not only do I prefer this to other raspberry imperials in those three departments, it also packs a stronger punch at 8.8% ac.   

Since I was a wee lad Ive had more than my fair share of stouts in volume & in variety and this one from my hometown sits near the very top on my board!

Its very strong barley-wine.  the name blithering idiot is accurate, certainly not a drink for the ladies or metrosexuals. PACKED with fruit. every bubble of carbonation excretes flavor and aroma, caramal and malt.  For the novice beer drinker this is not.   Put this one somewhere near the top of your list and work your way up.

The Hopback Amber Ale is still my favorite Troegs... actually this was how i was introduced to Troegs but its been a long time since.  This can be described as Creamy with a sweet taste thats not overpowering as are in some sweet stouts.  The y say its best with desserts but I have no regrets drinking it straight from the pint glass by itself.

ahg, oh my god get this away from me.  blasphemer.  dont get this even if youre broke/homeless/in college.  its awful in everyway. its the bottom of every beer you ever drank topped off with piss.  im not kidding.  if you want something cheap get some lionshead or augustiner if its not too taxed
First off, this is a killer IPA and necessary for anyone analyzing this type of drink. very flowery with a scent of citrus and hazy alcohol effect.

Its good.  but just that.  pricey where i am in small town USA. very malty, not a lot of hops prevalent. creamy head that lasts the whole way down. Id have it again... if there was nothing better, less prestigious even.

its not that good. BUT... if youre a college student without a dime to your name, this is a beer fit for kings.  seriously though, if youre not broke and under 21  i wouldnt give this beer much consideration.  good value, not so good beer.

what is ther to say about this beer?  its only downside is its hard to find unless you hail from the southeastern United States.   Briliant taste is intensified with the exhalation of some killer dank smoke.  The best beer to go with any buds.  I admit its downgraded from a 5 to about a 3.5 without the additon of marijuana.  Is this why they call it 420 ale... They claim cause it was first brewed on april 20th.. .but then again dont their tours start at 4:20 too.  If you like bud, try this beer.  if not    try it anyway!   if you can find it.

Not that great.  Ive had a lot of the rock bottom beers, most of which I dont see listed here.  but this was certainly one of the better ones.  this place really just doesnt seem to make beer that well for a restaurant whos entire marketing scheme is targeted toward their beer making ability.  The first time I went to this restuarant  I could tell i was getting ripped off.   I still go there cause they have great food, a lot of which is made with their beer.  I just suggest saving your money and getting a water instead of an overpriced and unfulfilling homebrewed beer.  The pesto pizza and  sausage soaked beer pizza is highly recommended.

Ive only had 6 of the Troegs brews but out of all those, this one took the cake by far.  Its taste is simply exquisite. Good head. Good smell. I have to admit its a bit on the hoppy side yet still not overpowering. A little bitter. Medium-to heavy fruityness. Its a good brew to take with meals. All in all, Id say theres no mans glass this beer isnt good enough to fill!
The spice is very inherent  and the bananas hardly noticeable.  I would recommend if youre a fan of the other Troegs brews or if you like wheat beers a lot.

beer_brewer_name: Old Dominion Brewing Company (Coastal Brewing Co.)
review_blob: This is just a delicious stout with a unique wood and vanilla taste.  its potent but not enough to overwhelm your tastebuds.  this could be good enough for anyone as a standard stout to keep your fridge stocked with.
